summary: Frederic Chen shares his process of building a portfolio website using Wix, detailing the customization and design decisions along the way.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a person wearing a yellow shirt and a blue hat is seen sitting in a room with a vibrant sunflower tapestry in the background. The individual is animated, using hand gestures to emphasize their points while speaking. The room is decorated with a red and black checkered blanket draped over a chair, a shelf filled with various items, and a pillow with a sunflower design. The person's expressions and gestures suggest they are engaged in a lively conversation or presentation. The setting is casual and colorful, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a music track playing that seems to be of the new age variety. It has an upbeat tone and features some kind of synthesized pan flute. A young male speaker begins addressing his audience with a casual tone, saying his name, followed by, "but you've requested it for years." He mentions that he goes to NYU, and that he's majoring in integrated digital media, and is concerned he is wasting tuition money. He also mentions that he made a video where he put in a poll about making a portfolio website. He is happy that most people voted "yes", and expects them to watch. The speaker explains that he is not just a YouTuber, but also does photography. He talks about having deleted a prior website, and dreads turning nineteen because it means he has to get a real job since "YouTuber" is not a fun thing to put on a resume, and that his username "damnjudation" turns some people off.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a person with blue hair and glasses is seen wearing a yellow shirt and a blue hat, sitting in a room with a vibrant sunflower tapestry in the background. The individual is engaged in a conversation, using hand gestures to emphasize their points. The room is decorated with a yellow chair draped with a red and black checkered blanket, a shelf with various items, and a pillow featuring a cat design. The person's expressions and gestures suggest they are explaining or discussing something with enthusiasm. The camera occasionally zooms in to capture close-up shots of the person's face and upper body, highlighting their facial expressions and the details of their attire. The overall atmosphere is casual and lively, with the colorful background adding to the cheerful ambiance.
events_list.audio_caption: A male speaker begins with a positive tone, expressing gratitude and mentioning a sponsorship from Wix. He emphasizes the importance of having a website in college and humorously comments on its expected inclusion with a resume. This is followed by a playful sound effect, like a sudden gust of wind. The speaker then confirms the perceived pretentiousness, and introduces the idea of showing the process of making a website.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a view of a Google search page, where the URL "wix.com/go/thatmidgetasian" is typed into the search bar. The scene transitions to the Wix website, displaying two options for creating a website: "Let Wix ADI Create a Website for You" and "Create Your Website with the Editor." The person in the video, wearing a yellow shirt and a blue cap, is seen gesturing towards the screen. The video then shows a selection of website templates under the category "Portfolio & CV Website Templates," including options like "Modern Artist," "Storyteller CV," "Actor & Model Resume," "Personal Resume," "Graphic Design Portfolio," "Business CV," and "Professional CV." The person continues to gesture towards the screen, indicating the various templates available for selection. The background features a colorful wall with floral patterns and a shelf with various items, creating a vibrant and creative atmosphere.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a male speaker suggesting a website and stating that the link is in the description. He then transitions to describing the Wix website as "pretty cute" and mentions two options, one of which he doesn't need because he is a "design major." He says he will use the Wix editor, which has around five pages, and notes seeing options, including an "attractive male." He mentions that there are a lot of options.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a person wearing a yellow shirt and a blue cap, standing in front of a colorful background filled with sunflowers and other vibrant decorations. The person appears to be explaining or demonstrating something, as indicated by their hand gestures and facial expressions. The scene transitions to a computer screen displaying the Wix website, showcasing various website templates categorized under 'Portfolio & CV Website Templates,' 'Photography,' 'Music & Musician,' and 'Design.' The templates include options like 'Portfolio & CV,' 'Photography,' 'Music & Musician,' and 'Design,' with examples such as 'Greg Saint' and 'Sophia.' The video then shifts to a close-up of the Wix editor interface, where the person is editing a website template titled 'I'm Lucia. Stylist & Fashion Designer.' The editor interface shows options for adding menus, pages, ads, media, and blogging, with a focus on customizing the text and images on the website. The person continues to edit the website, changing the text from 'I'm Lucia. Stylist & Fashion Designer' to 'FREDERIC CHEN' and 'PHOTOGRAPHER,' demonstrating the customization process. The video concludes with the person still engaged in editing the website, highlighting the ease of use and flexibility of the Wix editor.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a single speaker, a female, talking about portfolios and portraits, describing a simple portfolio design with a "spicy" background and mentioning her basic HTML, CSS, and Javascript skills. She discusses adding her name to the title, preferring sans-serif fonts that are bold and clean over more formal ones, and plans to change the font. She then mentions her photography, wanting to change the font again. She refers to a design rule against using bold and italics together, and notes she will change the font because it’s taking away from other type.

events_list.video_caption: The video showcases a person wearing a yellow shirt and a blue cap, sitting in front of a computer screen displaying the IXI web design software interface. The individual is seen interacting with the software, navigating through various menus and options. The screen displays a website template with the title "FREDERIC CHEN PHOTOGRAPHY" prominently featured. The person is seen selecting images from a gallery, organizing them, and adding them to the website template. The gallery contains a variety of photographs, including portraits, landscapes, and artistic shots. The person is also seen adjusting settings and editing text within the software. The background of the room includes colorful decorations, such as a sunflower painting and a stuffed animal, creating a vibrant and creative atmosphere. The video captures the process of designing and customizing a photography website using the IXI software.
events_list.audio_caption: A single male speaker begins with a slightly humorous, conversational tone, expressing disapproval of using bold fonts in the current economy. He then considers a "semi-bold" option and begins describing his process of curating photography for his gallery, mentioning deleting photos. He outlines his intent to allow viewers to judge his work, while asking they "don't be mean", referencing "cancer season." He then goes on to describe sifting through portrait photography and expresses the need to wait. He discusses projects, his bio, and creating a "nature photography" page. He reorganizes images, deleting "projects," adding four photos, and sorting them by color in a rainbow scheme. He expresses regret to his photography teacher for breaking the rules and apologizes to a model for overuse in photos. He considers switching things up and describes grid and masonry layouts. Eventually the male speaker finds a layout he likes and continues setting up the spacing around his layout.

events_list.video_caption: The video showcases a person wearing a yellow shirt and a blue cap, seated in front of a computer screen displaying a website design interface. The interface is for a photography website named "FREDERIC CHEN," featuring a beige background with the word "PHOTOGRAPHY" prominently displayed in large, bold letters. The website includes a gallery of photographs, including images of a woman in a red dress, a woman in a park, and a woman in a forest. The person is interacting with the website design, adjusting settings and animations, as indicated by the various options and tools visible on the screen. The environment suggests a creative workspace, with a colorful background featuring a sunflower painting and a toy visible behind the person. The video captures the process of customizing the website's layout and design elements, highlighting the user's engagement with the design software.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker discussing expanding photos for detail, mentioning an animation for photography. He references "glide" and "expand," dismissing the "spins" feature as not being "Microsoft PowerPoint." Expressing a strong dislike, he then states a preference for "fades" due to their simplicity. He notes a dislike for the spacing.

events_list.video_caption: The video showcases a person wearing a yellow shirt and a blue cap, seated in front of a colorful background adorned with sunflowers and various objects. The individual is engaged in editing a website using a web design tool, specifically focusing on a photography portfolio page. The editing process involves changing the page background color, adding and editing images, and adjusting text settings. The person navigates through different sections of the website, including a gallery and social media links, demonstrating the customization options available in the web design tool. The video highlights the user-friendly interface and the ability to personalize the website's appearance and content.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker discussing moving an element "a tad bit higher" and changing the background color to yellow using a hex value. He expresses his dislike for the initial color combination and suggests avoiding it due to its jarring effect, indicating a concern for user experience. The speaker then previews the changes, notices an unwanted name display, and considers adding borders. He expresses the desire for scrolling animations to fade in images as the page is scrolled, but he also removes information that he doesn’t want displayed. Further edits include adjusting element sizes and spacing, followed by a focus on social media links, and adding a LinkedIn request for connections. The speaker then edits text with drop shadows, but notes that he is currently unable to add the drop shadow and decides to return later. He switches to adding info, greeting the listener, introducing himself and his major, and admitting that he will add some additional information later. The male speaker then declares he will reflect on his work and take a break before finishing the website.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a vibrant, animated title card displaying the text "THE NEXT DAY" in bold purple letters against a yellow background adorned with musical instruments and notes, setting a lively and creative tone. The scene transitions to a computer screen showing a website design interface for a photography portfolio by Frederic Chen. The interface features a beige background with the word "PHOTOGRAPHY" prominently displayed in large, bold letters, accompanied by various photographs arranged in a grid layout. The photographs showcase different subjects and settings, including a person in a red outfit, a sunset scene, and a person walking in a park. The interface includes navigation options such as "PHOTOGRAPHY," "INFO," and "CONTACT," indicating the website's structure. The video then shifts to a person wearing a blue cap and a dark shirt, sitting in front of a colorful background with sunflowers and other decorations, suggesting a creative workspace. The person appears to be engaged in a conversation or presentation, as indicated by their hand gestures and facial expressions. The video wraps up with a close-up of a photograph featuring a person illuminated by a ring light, highlighting the focus on photography and creative expression.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with speech, a male speaker referring to "the next day." He discusses website updates, mentioning a problem with a "drop shadow" and his solution to group elements together. He then comments on a photo from two years ago, noting he looked better then. The speaking style is casual and conversational. There's some music playing softly in the background.

events_list.video_caption: The video showcases a webpage belonging to Frederic Chen, a content creator and digital media student at NYU Tandon. The webpage features a sidebar with icons for navigation, including options for home, about, work, and contact. The main content area includes a section titled "Who Am I?" which details Frederic's background, his YouTube channel, and his skills in Adobe programs. Accompanying images include a portrait of Frederic with a circular light effect and a photo of a garden. The webpage also highlights Frederic's proficiency in photography and video editing. The video transitions through different sections of the webpage, emphasizing Frederic's achievements and skills. The background of the webpage is a warm yellow, and the text is presented in a clean, modern font. The video concludes with a focus on the "Skills" section, showcasing Frederic's expertise in Adobe programs and his ability to work with a DSLR camera.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio features a single male speaker discussing the need to appear professional, saying, "as much as I would like to be a thirst trap." He emphasizes presenting oneself as skilled and articulate, while maintaining some level of formality. Throughout the speech, there's consistent background music, which has a pop style, with a neutral mood.

events_list.video_caption: The video showcases a person working on a website design using the Wix platform. The individual, wearing a blue cap and a dark shirt, is seated in front of a computer screen displaying the Wix editor interface. The screen is filled with various design elements and tools, including a navigation menu on the left side with options like 'Page Structure,' 'Page,' 'Vector Art,' and 'Social Media.' The main section of the screen features a website template with a beige background, showcasing a 'Who Am I?' section with a circular profile picture and text describing the person's background and skills. The text highlights their proficiency in Adobe programs and their experience as a content creator. The person is actively engaged in editing the website, as indicated by the cursor moving across the screen and the various design elements being manipulated. The background of the room includes a colorful wall with a sunflower painting and a shelf with various items, adding a personal touch to the workspace. The video captures the process of website creation, emphasizing the use of Wix's tools and the customization of design elements to create a professional online presence.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker expressing uncertainty about a previous decision, referring to a quote about art and stating, "I figured I can call myself those things." He then transitions to discussing his skills, mentioning Adobe programs and questioning the accuracy of representing skill levels with percentages. Continuing his monologue, the speaker talks about his website's contact page, stating his plans to add a contact form but avoiding direct business links. He then rejects the need for a contact page entirely, opting instead for just his email. The male speaker continues discussing aspects of his website design, including keeping the number of pages limited, the lack of confidence in his designs, and showcasing photography. Finally, he mentions a mobile site option, adjusting font sizes and icons, and rearranging elements on the page. Throughout the audio clip, the speaker uses a conversational, slightly hesitant tone.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a person wearing a blue hat and glasses, sitting in front of a vibrant sunflower tapestry, a red and black checkered blanket, and a shelf filled with various items. The person appears to be speaking, as indicated by their hand gestures and facial expressions. The scene transitions to a computer screen displaying the Wix website interface, where the user is setting up a new site. The user types 'frederic' into the domain name field and clicks 'Next,' leading to a loading screen. The next scene shows a completed Wix website with a photography portfolio, featuring a grid of images and a 'Who Am I?' section with a brief biography and skills. The video then returns to the person in front of the sunflower tapestry, continuing to speak and gesture, maintaining the same background and setting throughout.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a male speaker discussing his domain name, "frederickchin.com," and his satisfaction with it as a way to showcase his resume. He mentions his intention to add a design tab with his college work, hoping people visiting his resume will be aware of his design background. He then mentions needing design material and how it took him roughly two hours to make the website. The clip closes with someone saying "Anyways".

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a person wearing a blue hat and glasses, speaking in a room adorned with a sunflower tapestry and a red and black checkered blanket draped over a chair. The individual, dressed in a gray shirt, appears to be engaged in a conversation or presentation, as indicated by their hand gestures and facial expressions. The room is decorated with various items, including a shelf with bottles and a pillow featuring a sunflower design. The scene then transitions to a serene sunset, captured in a vintage-style frame, showcasing a gradient sky from deep blue to warm orange hues as the sun descends below the horizon. The video concludes with a series of black frames, suggesting a transition or a pause in the visual narrative.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male speaker expressing a preference for simple websites. He thanks Wix for sponsoring him and encourages viewers to sign up, like, comment, and subscribe. He expresses affection and announces plans to apply for jobs. This is followed by somber and dramatic orchestral music, possibly for a movie or show, with prominent string instruments, and finally the music fades out.
